newsitem.title: UK: MSAS joint venture with Blue Skies in India.
newsitem.headline: MSAS joint venture with Blue Skies in India.

text.p: MSAS Cargo International said it has taken a 60 percent stake in an Indian joint venture with Bombay-based Blue Skies Private Ltd.
The two companies have worked together for 20 years and Blue Skies was previously MSAS' agent partner, it said in a statement.
From today, the 300 staff of the new MSAS Blue Skies Ltd will provide a full range of airfreight, seafreight, onforwarding and logistics support services from its 15 offices within India.
At ports and airports, where local communications are difficult, operating staff are equipped with mobile telephones to keep them in constant contact with customers.
The joint venture has offices in Bombay, Madras, New Delhi, Calcutta, Ahmedabad, Bangalore, Chandigarh, Cochin, Coimbatore, Goa, Hyderabad, Kanpur, Pune, Trivandrurn and Vishakapatnam, it added.
The UK-based MSAS Cargo International employs nearly 6000 people in 112 countries. It is a subsidiary of Ocean Group Plc.
